program: Master of Science in Biomedical Informatics (MS)

sections.text: Stanford’s Biomedical Informatics MS emphasizes research‑driven training in computational methods for biomedicine, preparing students to develop novel algorithms and models for biological and clinical data.

items: Advising by academic and research mentors
Options for academic (full‑time) or HCP professional track
sections.text: All students complete core coursework and select electives; academic MS students typically finish in two years with a substantial project or paper.

items: Program sheet and advising per BMI handbook
sections.text: Admission follows program policies without GRE; students adhere to University graduate degree requirements and BMI advising.
Graduates contribute to research and applied informatics in healthcare, biotech, and data‑driven medicine.
